message.content: This question requires observations about dog behavior and some understanding of how dogs regulate their body temperature. On a hot summer day, a dog stuck outside will try to cool itself down by panting. When a dog pants, it may appear to be smiling with its mouth open, but in reality, it is trying to regulate its body temperature and cool down. Option (A) is incorrect because dogs do not sweat like humans do. Option (B) is unrelated to the dog's behavior in this situation. Option (D) is incorrect because shivering is a response to being cold, not to being hot.

Option (B) is incorrect because it suggests the dog is trying to get inside, not cool down. Option (D) is incorrect because shivering is a response to cold temperatures, not heat.
